Pictophonetic: 倉 indicates the sound; 疒 (sickness) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: A sore is like a storehouse of a sickness.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A sore is like a storehouse of a sickness.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "疒" to " Cang " sound. The original meaning is wounds and traumas, and the original meaning is " wound ". There is no " sore " in "Shuowen". "Said Wen": "刅, hurt. From the blade from one. Chuang, or from the knife, Cangsheng." "Jade Chapter. "Shen Bu": "Sore, sore. Ancient creation." Such as "Warring States Policy. "Chu Ce IV": "Those who fly slowly, so sores are also painful; those who mourn are lost for a long time, so the sores are not healed, but the shock has not yet come." "Three Kingdoms" Chapter 56: "(Zhou Yu) Arrow The sore had not healed, but due to anger, the sore burst and fell to the ground."

" Sore " later specifically referred to ulcers, boils, and skin diseases. Such as "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Ming Emperor Ji": "Drink people to use water, and to wash sores, or more healing." "The Family Instructions of Yan Family. "Name and Reality": "If you taste it in the thatch, smear your face with croton, then it will cause sores, which means you have been crying."

" Sore " is extended to mean people's livelihood is suffering. Such as "Salt Iron Theory. "National Diseases": "However, its disasters have been repeated for many generations , and the devastation has not ceased ." " Suffocation " also refers to trauma. Du Fu of the Tang Dynasty "Zhuangyou": "Suppose you feel the burning of nine temples, and feel sorry for the sores."
humanum_short_description_en: From "疒" to " Cang " sound. The original meaning is wounds and traumas, and the original meaning is " wound ".
humanum_full_description:
從「疒」，「倉」聲。本義是傷口、外傷，本作「創」。《說文》無「瘡」字。《說文》：「刅，傷也。从刃从一。創，或从刀，倉聲。」《玉篇．疒部》：「瘡，瘡痍也。古作創。」如《戰國策．楚策四》：「飛徐者，故瘡痛也；鳴悲者，久失群也，故瘡未息，而驚心未至也。」《三國演義》第56回：「（周瑜）箭瘡未癒，因怒氣沖激，瘡口迸裂，昏絕於地。」

　　「瘡」後來專指潰瘍、瘡癤，乃皮膚病名。如《三國志．魏書．明帝紀》：「飲人以水，及以洗瘡，或多愈者。」《顏氏家訓．名實》：「而嘗於苫塊之中，以巴豆塗臉，遂使成瘡，表哭泣之過。」

　　「瘡」又引申表示民生疾苦。如《鹽鐵論．國疾》：「然其禍累世不復，瘡痍至今未息。」「痍」亦指創傷。唐代杜甫〈壯遊〉：「上感九廟焚，下憫萬人瘡。」
humanum_short_description: 從「疒」，「倉」聲。本義是傷口、外傷，本作「創」。

瘡疤 [ chuāng bā ]: scar
(Simplified: 疮)
Pictophonetic: 倉 indicates the sound; 疒 (sickness) conveys the meaning.
Chinese: A sore is like a storehouse of a sickness.
Meaning: sore
Hanzi: 疮
Story: A sore is like a storehouse of a sickness.
Kind: traditional
從「 疒 」，「 倉 」聲。本義是傷口、外傷，本作「 創 」。《說文》無「 瘡 」字。《說文》：「刅，傷也。从刃从一。創，或从刀，倉聲。」《玉篇．疒部》：「瘡，瘡痍也。古作創。」如《戰國策．楚策四》：「飛徐者，故瘡痛也；鳴悲者，久失群也，故瘡未息，而驚心未至也。」《三國演義》第56回：「（周瑜）箭瘡未癒，因怒氣沖激，瘡口迸裂，昏絕於地。」 「 瘡 」後來專指潰瘍、瘡癤，乃皮膚病名。如《三國志．魏書．明帝紀》：「飲人以水，及以洗瘡，或多愈者。」《顏氏家訓．名實》：「而嘗於苫塊之中，以巴豆塗臉，遂使成瘡，表哭泣之過。」 「 瘡 」又引申表示民生疾苦。如《鹽鐵論．國疾》：「然其禍累世不復，瘡痍至今未息。」「 痍 」亦指創傷。唐代杜甫〈壯遊〉：「上感九廟焚，下憫萬人瘡。」

Chuang, or from the knife, Cangsheng." "Jade Chapter. "Shen Bu": "Sore, sore. Ancient creation." Such as "Warring States Policy. "Chu Ce IV": "Those who fly slowly, so sores are also painful; those who mourn are lost for a long time, so the sores are not healed, but the shock has not yet come." "Three Kingdoms" Chapter 56: "(Zhou Yu) Arrow The sore had not healed, but due to anger, the sore burst and fell to the ground." " Sore" later specifically referred to ulcers, boils, and skin diseases. Such as "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Ming Emperor Ji": "Drink people to use water, and to wash sores, or more healing." "The Family Instructions of Yan Family. "Name and Reality": "If you taste it in the thatch, smear your face with croton, then it will cause sores, which means you have been crying." " Sore" is extended to mean people's livelihood is suffering. Such as "Salt Iron Theory. "National Diseases": "However, its disasters have been repeated for many generations, and the devastation has not ceased." " Suffocation" also refers to trauma. Du Fu of the Tang Dynasty "Zhuangyou": "Suppose you feel the burning of nine temples, and feel sorry for the sores."

瘡字的基本解释

瘡
chuāng
见“疮”。

瘡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chuāng］
［《廣韻》初良切，平陽，初。］
“疮1”的繁体字。
(1)创。创伤；创口。
(2)疮疖；溃疡。
(3)喻伤痛，痛苦。

瘡字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【疒字部】　瘡； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页778第13
〔古文〕創【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】初良切【正韻】初莊切，?音瑲。【玉篇】瘡，痍也。【集韻】痏也。【韻會】瘍也，痍也。【釋名】瘡，牫也，?毀體使傷也。【張衡·西京賦】所惡成瘡痏。【註】創痏謂瘢痕。【南史·宋武帝紀】虎魄療金瘡。　又【集韻】磢霜切。義同。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Concentration] [Department of Sui Characters] 　 Sore; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 778 13
[Ancient text] Create [Guangyun] [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Chuliangqie [Zhengyun] Chuzhuangqie,? Yinyan. [Jade articles] Sore, stubbornness. [Ji Yun] Wei Ye. 【Yunhui】Ulcer, 痍. [Release name] Sore, sore, or damage to the body. [Zhang Heng·Xijing Fu] The evil became sore. [Note] Wounds are called scars. [Southern History·Song Wu Emperor Ji] Tiger soul cures golden sores.　[Ji Yun] Shuangshuang cut. The same meaning.
